intro: Melampodium dicoelocarpum, commonly known as the two-seeded ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Melampodium dicoelocarpum is often found in prairies and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils.
